flounder.maths

Class Maths

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.maths.Maths

  • public class Maths
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that holds many various math functions.

      • floorMod

        public static int floorMod(int numerator,
                           int denominator)
        A flooring modulus operator. Works similarly to the % operator, except this rounds towards negative infinity rather than towards 0.

        For example:
        -7 % 3 = -2; floorMod(-7, 3) = 2
        -6 % 3 = -0; floorMod(-6, 3) = 0
        -5 % 3 = -2; floorMod(-5, 3) = 1
        -4 % 3 = -1; floorMod(-4, 3) = 2
        -3 % 3 = -0; floorMod(-3, 3) = 0
        -2 % 3 = -2; floorMod(-2, 3) = 1
        -1 % 3 = -1; floorMod(-1, 3) = 2
        0 % 3 = 0; floorMod(0, 3) = 0
        1 % 3 = 1; floorMod(1, 3) = 1
        2 % 3 = 2; floorMod(2, 3) = 2
        3 % 3 = 0; floorMod(3, 3) = 0
        4 % 3 = 1; floorMod(4, 3) = 1

        Parameters:
        numerator - The numerator of the modulus operator.
        denominator - The denominator of the modulus operator.
        Returns:
        numerator % denominator, rounded towards negative infinity.

      • floorMod

        public static double floorMod(double numerator,
                              double denominator)
        A flooring modulus operator. Works similarly to the % operator, except this rounds towards negative infinity rather than towards 0.

        For example:
        -7 % 3 = -2; floorMod(-7, 3) = 2
        -6 % 3 = -0; floorMod(-6, 3) = 0
        -5 % 3 = -2; floorMod(-5, 3) = 1
        -4 % 3 = -1; floorMod(-4, 3) = 2
        -3 % 3 = -0; floorMod(-3, 3) = 0
        -2 % 3 = -2; floorMod(-2, 3) = 1
        -1 % 3 = -1; floorMod(-1, 3) = 2
        0 % 3 = 0; floorMod(0, 3) = 0
        1 % 3 = 1; floorMod(1, 3) = 1
        2 % 3 = 2; floorMod(2, 3) = 2
        3 % 3 = 0; floorMod(3, 3) = 0
        4 % 3 = 1; floorMod(4, 3) = 1

        Parameters:
        numerator - The numerator of the modulus operator.
        denominator - The denominator of the modulus operator.
        Returns:
        numerator % denominator, rounded towards negative infinity.

        Returns:
        The rounded value.

      • deadband

        public static float deadband(float min,
                             float value)
        Used to floor the value if less than the min.
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum value.
        value - The value.
        Returns:
        Returns a value with deadband applied.

      • clamp

        public static float clamp(float value,
                          float min,
                          float max)
        Ensures value is in the range of min to max. If value is greater than max, this will return max. If value is less than min, this will return min. Otherwise, value is returned unchanged.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to clamp.
        min - The smallest value of the result.
        max - The largest value of the result.
        Returns:
        value, clamped between min and max.

      • limit

        public static float limit(float value,
                          float limit)
        Limits the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value.
        limit - The limit.
        Returns:
        A limited value.

      • baryCentric

        public static float baryCentric(Vector3f p1,
                                Vector3f p2,
                                Vector3f p3,
                                Vector2f pos)
        Gets the height on a point off of a 3d triangle.
        Parameters:
        p1 - Point 1 on the triangle.
        p2 - Point 2 on the triangle.
        p3 - Point 3 on the triangle.
        pos - The XZ position of the object.
        Returns:
        Height of the triangle at the position.

      • cosInterpolate

        public static float cosInterpolate(float a,
                                   float b,
                                   float blend)
        Interpolates two values by a blendFactor using cos interpolation.
        Parameters:
        a - The first value.
        b - The second value.
        blend - The blend value.
        Returns:
        Returns a interpolated value.
